```{r library and read in file, echo=FALSE, include=FALSE, results=FALSE}
#If you ever load a library, please do it here
library(tidyverse)
library(ggplot2)
library(dplyr)
library(knitr)
library(kableExtra)
library(readxl)
library(tidyr)

getwd()

SDG_Data<-read_excel("./SDGEXCEL.xlsx", col_types = "text")

#Set theme
mytheme <- theme_classic() +
  theme(axis.text = element_text(color = "black"), 
        legend.position = "top")
theme_set(mytheme)

SDG_Data<- SDG_Data %>%
  filter(`Country Name`=="Brazil"|`Country Name`=="China"|`Country Name`=="United States" | `Country Name`== "Russian Federation" |`Country Name`=="India") %>%
  filter(`Indicator Name`== "CO2 emissions (metric tons per capita)" | `Indicator Name`=="PM2.5 air pollution, mean annual exposure (micrograms per cubic meter)" |`Indicator Name`=="Renewable electricity output (% of total electricity output)"| `Indicator Name`=="Mortality from CVD, cancer, diabetes or CRD between exact ages 30 and 70, female (%)"|`Indicator Name`=="GDP per capita (current US$)") %>%
  mutate(Year15 = `2015`) %>%
  select(`Country Name`, `Indicator Name`, `Year15`) 

SDG_Data$Year15<-as.numeric(SDG_Data$Year15)

#Selected 2015 because it was the only year that had data in for everything


```

```{r summary stats, echo=FALSE}

summarystats<- SDG_Data %>%
  group_by(`Indicator Name`)%>%
  summarize(variable.mean=signif(mean(`Year15`, na.rm=TRUE),5),
              variable.median=signif(median(`Year15`, na.rm=TRUE),5),
              variable.sd=signif(sd(`Year15`, na.rm=TRUE),4))

summary.table<-kable(summarystats, col.names = c("Variable", "Mean", "Median", "Standard Deviation"), caption = "Summary Statistics of Variables in Countries")
summary.table

```

```{r spread, echo=FALSE}
SDG_Data.short<-SDG_Data %>%
  spread(`Indicator Name`, Year15)

```

```{r rename, echo=FALSE}

SDG_Data.short<-SDG_Data.short %>%
  rename(Country = `Country Name`, CO2 = `CO2 emissions (metric tons per capita)`, Mortality = `Mortality from CVD, cancer, diabetes or CRD between exact ages 30 and 70, female (%)`, GDP = `GDP per capita (current US$)`, PM2.5 = `PM2.5 air pollution, mean annual exposure (micrograms per cubic meter)`, Renew = `Renewable electricity output (% of total electricity output)`)

SDG_Data.short
```
```{r plots, echo=FALSE}
#Put all plots here
CO2plot<-ggplot(SDG_Data.short, aes(x= CO2, y= Mortality,  color = Country)) +
  geom_point() +
  labs(x = "CO2 emissions", y= "Mortality Rate", title= "This is no fun")

CO2plot


```
```{r statistical analysis, echo=FALSE}

model<- lm(data = SDG_Data.short, GDP ~ Mortality + Renew + PM2.5 + CO2)
summary(model)

reg1<-lm(SDG_Data.short$GDP ~ SDG_Data.short$CO2)
print(reg1)
summary(reg1)

reg2<-lm(SDG_Data.short$GDP ~ SDG_Data.short$PM2.5)
print(reg2)
summary(reg2)

reg3<-lm(SDG_Data.short$PM2.5 ~ SDG_Data.short$Mortality)
print(reg3)
summary(reg3)

reg4<-lm(SDG_Data.short$CO2 ~ SDG_Data.short$Renew)
print(reg4)
summary(reg4)

reg5<-lm(SDG_Data.short$Mortality ~ SDG_Data.short$Renew)

summary(reg5)
```
